pullrequest.title: Added quickstart and fixed starting box

content.raw: Looks good to me as it is for now but it might be a problem when merging pull request #44 \(comms model\). After that pull request, each comms client constructor \(running in a ROS node\) will try to register in the broker \(located inside a Gazebo world plugin\). If we launch `quickstart.launch`, it might be the case that the plugin is still not running and the comms client cannot register. Maybe a solution could be to write a script that starts the Gazebo world and only when is ready, launch `team.launch`. We could launch this script from `quickstart.launch`.
content.html: Looks good to me as it is for now but it might be a problem when merging pull request #44 (comms model). After that pull request, each comms client constructor (running in a ROS node) will try to register in the broker (located inside a Gazebo world plugin). If we launch quickstart.launch, it might be the case that the plugin is still not running and the comms client cannot register. Maybe a solution could be to write a script that starts the Gazebo world and only when is ready, launch team.launch. We could launch this script from quickstart.launch.

pullrequest.title: Added quickstart and fixed starting box

content.raw: I believe we discovered that this will be okay. There is a 3 second time-out in the `CommsClient`, which should be sufficient time for the gazebo broker plugin to load.
content.html: I believe we discovered that this will be okay. There is a 3 second time-out in the CommsClient, which should be sufficient time for the gazebo broker plugin to load.
